meanings.definition: In a manner lacking energy or vitality.
meanings.sent1: She moved languidly across the room, showing no sign of energy.
meanings.sent2: He spoke languidly, his words slow and lacking vitality.
meanings.sent3: The cat stretched languidly in the sun, enjoying a lazy day.
meanings.sent4: The flowers drooped languidly in the heat, wilting without energy.
meanings.sent5: The old car moved languidly up the hill, struggling with no vitality.

meanings.definition: In a relaxed or unhurried manner.
meanings.sent1: She sipped her tea languidly, enjoying the peaceful moment.
meanings.sent2: The couple strolled languidly along the beach, taking their time.
meanings.sent3: The child swung languidly on the swing, lost in his own world.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed languidly through the valley, in no rush to reach the sea.
meanings.sent5: The clouds drifted languidly across the sky, moving slowly and peacefully.
